intro: Psychotria procumbens, commonly known as the creeping psychotria, is a tropical plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to regions of Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with slender stems that often root at the nodes. Its small, elliptical leaves are typically dark green and have a glossy surface. Psychotria procumbens produces small, white to pale green flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences.
